channel.title: Northwest C++ Users’ Group - Peter Williamson

item.title: Welcome to the Northwest C++ Users’ Group
item.description: The Northwest C++ Users’ Group (NWCPP) is a group of professional developers and hobbyists living and working in the Pacific Northwest who meet monthly to discuss trends, techniques, and technology regarding the C++ language and industry. The group meetings and resources are free, and anyone and everyone is welcome to …
item.dc:creator: Peter Williamson

item.title: Microsoft Meeting Room: Reactor, Building 20
item.description:
Our meetings are held at the main Microsoft campus, in the Reactor Room, Building 20, at the corner of NE 31st and 156th Ave NE, in Redmond, WA.

If you use the main entrance from 156th (NE 26th St), take the first left onto Microsoft Way, and the Reactor room …
item.dc:creator: Peter Williamson
